definitions.definition: A small river; a large creek; a body of moving water confined by banks.
A thin connected passing of a liquid through a lighter gas (e.g. air).
definitions.example: He poured the milk in a thin stream from the jug to the glass.

definitions.definition: Any steady flow or succession of material, such as water, air, radio signal or words.
definitions.example: Her constant nagging was to him a stream of abuse.

definitions.definition: A source or repository of data that can be read or written only sequentially.
A particular path, channel, division, or way of proceeding.
definitions.example: Haredi Judaism is a stream of Orthodox Judaism characterized by rejection of modern secular culture.

definitions.definition: A division of a school year by perceived ability.
definitions.example: All of the bright kids went into the A stream, but I was in the B stream.

definitions.definition: To flow in a continuous or steady manner, like a liquid.
To extend; to stretch out with a wavy motion; to float in the wind.
definitions.example: A flag streams in the wind.
The soldier's wound was streaming blood.

definitions.definition: To push continuous data (e.g. music) from a server to a client computer while it is being used (played) on the client.
